div1.p: [Dawson] regrets that he will be unable to attend the Founder's Day ceremonies.

div1.head: Letter from [Lord Dawson] to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, February 13, 1937
div1.p:
I am greatly honoured by your kind
suggestion to be present at your Founders' Day in October
of this year.

It is always a pleasure to me to go to
the United States and it is a matter of regret that some
years have now passed since I was there last.

I am afraid, however, that my duties in
England will prevent me from being absent from this country
during next autumn, and therefore with great regret I cannot
avail myself of your kind invitation.

In no sections of our respective national
lives is there so much mutual confidence, sympathy and friend-
ship as amongst the doctors of our two countries.

In once again thanking you may I express the
hope that you will have a most successful gathering.
